m_szDocTitle: An Analysis Shows That China Will Be Powered By Renewable Energy Soon
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- Originally published on WWF . By Chris Conner. By embracing conservation measures and renewable energy, China can transition to an 80 percent renewable electric power system by 2050 at far less cost than continuing to rely on coal, according to a new report from World Wildlife Fund (WWF). As a result, China’s carbon emissions from power generation could be 90 percent less than currently projected levels in 2050 without compromising the reliability of the electric grid or slowing economic growth.
